titlestmt.author: Erik Stolarski

repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.unittitle: President's Task Force on Priorities and Resources Records1975-1977

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: State University of New York at Albany

did.abstract: Collection is made up of materials related to the recommendations of changes for the University that came from a Task Force created by the president.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is maintained in the order that it was recieved in.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The items included in this collection are meeting minutes, departmental evaluations, finance reports, as well as recommendations for University improvements. These documents all proceedings of the Task Force as well as the response by University Administration. This includes a cumulative report published and sent to the President of the University in May of 1975. The report detailed recommendations on admission and curriculum both campus wide and at the department level. They also gave reccomendations on how to follow through on these plans.

bioghist.head: Administrative Note
bioghist.p: President's Task Force on Priorities and Resources was a group created by the President to work on updating and assessing the University from within. The Task Force was made up of members from each major department of the University. A product of this was the publishing of a report in May of 1975 about their findings related to each individual department.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Full collection was donated to the archive from Arthur Hitchcock, a former memeber of the Task Force.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows: Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, The President Task Force on Priorities and Resources. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the President's Task Force on Priorities and Resources.).
